alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 12:41PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern DeSoto, northwestern Marshall and south central Shelby Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lynchburg, or over Horn Lake, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Byhalia, Walls, Southwest Memphis, Lynchburg, Lewisburg, Whitehaven, Cockrum, Cedarview, Bright, Nesbit, Handy Corner, Capleville, Glover and Jago. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
